to_real_linear_isometry_equiv_symm_apply:
/- ./././Mathport/Syntax/Translate/Expr.lean:207:4: warning: unsupported notation `«expr ≃ᵢ » -/
@[simp]
theorem to_real_linear_isometry_equiv_symm_apply (f : «expr ≃ᵢ » E F) (y : F) :
    (f.to_real_linear_isometry_equiv.symm : F → E) y = f.symm (y + f 0) :=
  rfl
#align to_real_linear_isometry_equiv_symm_apply to_real_linear_isometry_equiv_symm_apply
to_real_linear_equiv_apply:
/- ./././Mathport/Syntax/Translate/Expr.lean:207:4: warning: unsupported notation `«expr ≃ᵢ » -/
@[simp]
theorem to_real_linear_equiv_apply (f : «expr ≃ᵢ » E F) (x : E) :
    (f.to_real_linear_isometry_equiv : E → F) x = f x - f 0 :=
  (sub_eq_add_neg (f x) (f 0)).symm
#align to_real_linear_equiv_apply to_real_linear_equiv_apply
midpoint_fixed:
/- ./././Mathport/Syntax/Translate/Expr.lean:207:4: warning: unsupported notation `exprℝ -/
/- ./././Mathport/Syntax/Translate/Expr.lean:207:4: warning: unsupported notation `«expr ≃ᵢ » -/
/- ./././Mathport/Syntax/Translate/Expr.lean:207:4: warning: unsupported notation `«expr ≃ᵢ » -/
/- ./././Mathport/Syntax/Translate/Expr.lean:207:4: warning: unsupported notation `exprℝ -/
/- ./././Mathport/Syntax/Translate/Expr.lean:207:4: warning: unsupported notation `«expr ≃ᵢ » -/
/- ./././Mathport/Syntax/Translate/Expr.lean:207:4: warning: unsupported notation `«expr ≃ᵢ » -/
/- ./././Mathport/Syntax/Translate/Expr.lean:207:4: warning: unsupported notation `«expr⨆ , » -/
/- ./././Mathport/Syntax/Translate/Expr.lean:210:13: unsupported notation `«expr⨆ , » -/
/- ./././Mathport/Syntax/Translate/Expr.lean:207:4: warning: unsupported notation `«expr ≃ᵢ » -/
/- ./././Mathport/Syntax/Translate/Expr.lean:207:4: warning: unsupported notation `exprℝ -/
/- ./././Mathport/Syntax/Translate/Expr.lean:207:4: warning: unsupported notation `«expr ≃ᵢ » -/
/- ./././Mathport/Syntax/Translate/Expr.lean:207:4: warning: unsupported notation `exprℝ -/
/- ./././Mathport/Syntax/Translate/Expr.lean:207:4: warning: unsupported notation `exprℝ -/

/-- If an isometric self-homeomorphism of a normed vector space over `ℝ` fixes `x` and `y`,
then it fixes the midpoint of `[x, y]`. This is a lemma for a more general Mazur-Ulam theorem,
see below. -/
theorem midpoint_fixed {x y : PE} :
    ∀ e : «expr ≃ᵢ » PE PE, e x = x → e y = y → e (midpoint (exprℝ) x y) = midpoint (exprℝ) x y :=
  by
  set z := midpoint (exprℝ) x y
  -- Consider the set of `e : E ≃ᵢ E` such that `e x = x` and `e y = y`
  set s := { e : «expr ≃ᵢ » PE PE | e x = x ∧ e y = y }
  haveI : Nonempty s := ⟨⟨IsometryEquiv.refl PE, rfl, rfl⟩⟩
  -- On the one hand, `e` cannot send the midpoint `z` of `[x, y]` too far
  have h_bdd : BddAbove (range fun e : s => dist (e z) z) :=
    by
    refine' ⟨dist x z + dist x z, forall_range_iff.2 <| Subtype.forall.2 _⟩
    rintro e ⟨hx, hy⟩
    calc
      dist (e z) z ≤ dist (e z) x + dist x z := dist_triangle (e z) x z
      _ = dist (e x) (e z) + dist x z := by rw [hx, dist_comm]
      _ = dist x z + dist x z := by erw [e.dist_eq x z]
      
  -- On the other hand, consider the map `f : (E ≃ᵢ E) → (E ≃ᵢ E)`
  -- sending each `e` to `R ∘ e⁻¹ ∘ R ∘ e`, where `R` is the point reflection in the
  -- midpoint `z` of `[x, y]`.
  set R : «expr ≃ᵢ » PE PE := (point_reflection (exprℝ) z).to_isometry_equiv
  set f : «expr ≃ᵢ » PE PE → «expr ≃ᵢ » PE PE := fun e => ((e.trans R).trans e.symm).trans R
  -- Note that `f` doubles the value of ``dist (e z) z`
  have hf_dist : ∀ e, dist (f e z) z = 2 * dist (e z) z :=
    by
    intro e
    dsimp [f]
    rw [dist_point_reflection_fixed, ← e.dist_eq, e.apply_symm_apply, dist_point_reflection_self_real, dist_comm]
  -- Also note that `f` maps `s` to itself
  have hf_maps_to : maps_to f s s := by
    rintro e ⟨hx, hy⟩
    constructor <;> simp [hx, hy, e.symm_apply_eq.2 hx.symm, e.symm_apply_eq.2 hy.symm]
  -- Therefore, `dist (e z) z = 0` for all `e ∈ s`.
  set c :=
    «expr⨆ , » "./././Mathport/Syntax/Translate/Expr.lean:210:13: unsupported notation `«expr⨆ , »"
      (dist ((e : «expr ≃ᵢ » PE PE) z) z)
  have : c ≤ c / 2 := by
    apply csupᵢ_le
    rintro ⟨e, he⟩
    simp only [Subtype.coe_mk, le_div_iff' (zero_lt_two' (exprℝ)), ← hf_dist]
    exact le_csupᵢ h_bdd ⟨f e, hf_maps_to he⟩
  replace : c ≤ 0
  · linarith
  refine' fun e hx hy => dist_le_zero.1 (le_trans _ this)
  exact le_csupᵢ h_bdd ⟨e, hx, hy⟩
#align midpoint_fixed midpoint_fixed
map_midpoint:
/- ./././Mathport/Syntax/Translate/Expr.lean:207:4: warning: unsupported notation `«expr ≃ᵢ » -/
/- ./././Mathport/Syntax/Translate/Expr.lean:207:4: warning: unsupported notation `exprℝ -/
/- ./././Mathport/Syntax/Translate/Expr.lean:207:4: warning: unsupported notation `exprℝ -/
/- ./././Mathport/Syntax/Translate/Expr.lean:207:4: warning: unsupported notation `exprℝ -/
/- ./././Mathport/Syntax/Translate/Expr.lean:207:4: warning: unsupported notation `exprℝ -/
/- ./././Mathport/Syntax/Translate/Expr.lean:207:4: warning: unsupported notation `«expr ≃ᵢ » -/
/- ./././Mathport/Syntax/Translate/Expr.lean:207:4: warning: unsupported notation `exprℝ -/
/- ./././Mathport/Syntax/Translate/Expr.lean:207:4: warning: unsupported notation `exprℝ -/
/-- A bijective isometry sends midpoints to midpoints. -/
theorem map_midpoint (f : «expr ≃ᵢ » PE PF) (x y : PE) : f (midpoint (exprℝ) x y) = midpoint (exprℝ) (f x) (f y) :=
  by
  set e : «expr ≃ᵢ » PE PE :=
    ((f.trans <| (point_reflection (exprℝ) <| midpoint (exprℝ) (f x) (f y)).to_isometry_equiv).trans f.symm).trans
      (point_reflection (exprℝ) <| midpoint (exprℝ) x y).to_isometry_equiv
  have hx : e x = x := by simp
  have hy : e y = y := by simp
  have hm := e.midpoint_fixed hx hy
  simp only [e, trans_apply] at hm
  rwa [← eq_symm_apply, to_isometry_equiv_symm, point_reflection_symm, coe_to_isometry_equiv, coe_to_isometry_equiv,
    point_reflection_self, symm_apply_eq, point_reflection_fixed_iff] at hm
#align map_midpoint map_midpoint
